label: Contractor shall require employee candidates needing T4 or T5 background investigation to submit information and documentation immediately upon CBP request.
quote: The Contractor shall require Contractor Employee candidates, needing a T4 or T5 background investigation for the contract, to submit information and documentation requested by CBP to initiate the background investigation process immediately upon request by CBP.

label: Contractor is responsible for ensuring all Contract Employee candidates complete e-QIP and Electronic Fingerprints using full legal name and correct SSN within 30 days of e-QIP initiation.
quote: The Contractor is responsible for ensuring all Contract Employee candidates complete the Electronic Questionnaire for Investigations Processing (e-QIP) and Electronic Fingerprints using their full legal name, correct SSN and ensuring these actions are completed in a timely manner, within 30 days of e-QIP initiation.

label: Contractor is responsible for ensuring all Contract Employee candidates respond to phone calls and check emails regularly for CBP Security Office communications.
quote: The Contractor is also responsible for ensuring all Contract Employee candidates respond to phone calls and check their emails regularly for communications from the CBP Security Office and/or the field investigator for any necessary actions.

label: Contractor must submit appropriate forms, including clearance documents if applicable, to the COR assigned to the contract.
quote: The appropriate forms, to include 'clearance' documents if applicable, must be submitted to the COR assigned to the contract, and the COR shall forward the completed forms to the CBP security official that will review the information for completeness and begin the adjudication and 'clearance' (if applicable) process.

label: Contractor shall propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the CO and COR within 30 days after being notified of a discontinued Contract Employee candidate.
quote: The Contractor shall then propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the CO and COR within 30 days after being notified of the discontinued Contract Employee candidate.

label: Contractor is required to provide names of employees who successfully complete CBP T4 or T5 process to the CO and COR.
quote: During the term of this contract, the Contractor is required to provide the names of its employees who successfully complete the CBP T4 or T5 process to the CO and COR.

label: Contractor shall propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the CO and COR within 30 days after being notified of an unsuccessful key personnel candidate or vacancy.
quote: For key personnel, the Contractor shall propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the CO and COR within 30 days after being notified of an unsuccessful candidate or vacancy.

label: For non-key personnel, Contractor shall propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the COR within 30 days after being notified of an unsuccessful candidate or vacancy.
quote: For all non-key personnel Contractor Employees, the Contractor shall propose a qualified replacement employee candidate to the COR within 30 days after being notified of an unsuccessful candidate or vacancy.

label: CO/COR shall approve or disapprove replacement employees.
quote: The CO/COR shall approve or disapprove replacement employees.

label: Continuous failure to provide Contractor Employees who meet CBP T4 or T5 requirements may be cause for termination of the contract.
quote: For contracts requiring Contractor Employees to possess a CBP suitability per SOW/PWS requirements, continuous failure to provide Contractor Employees who meet CBP T4 or T5 requirements may be cause for termination of the contract.

label: Contractor Employees who require access to classified information must be U.S. citizens or have Lawful Permanent Resident (LPR) status.
quote: Contractor Employees who require access to classified information must be U.S. citizens or have Lawful Permanent Resident (LPR) status in accordance with DHS Instruction Handbook 121-01-007-01, Rev. 01, the Department of Homeland Security Personnel Security, Suitability and Fitness Program, Chapter 2, Personnel Security Program Standards, ยง 13, Citizenship Requirements.

label: A waiver for citizenship requirements may be granted as outlined in DHS Instruction Handbook 121-01-007-01.
quote: A waiver may be granted, as outlined in Chapter 2, ยง 14 of DHS Instruction Handbook 121-01-007-01.
